summary: An FBI document describing architectural features and hidden compartments installed at Jeffrey Epstein's residence in the 1990s, including a rotating fireplace with a hidden staircase and concealed gun cases built into furniture.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is identified as the person who requested the installation of concealed gun cases in furniture at his residence.

events.title: Construction of hidden features at Epstein residence
events.description: During renovations in the 1990s, a rotating fireplace with a hidden staircase and concealed gun cases were installed in Epstein's residence at his request.

keyFacts: A rotating fireplace in the second-floor library concealed a hidden staircase, accessed via a concealed push button.
The fireplace and mantle rotated 90 degrees on a center point to reveal the staircase.
Approximately half a dozen shoebox-sized gun cases were installed in large furniture pieces (couches, coffee tables) at Epstein's request.
The gun cases could be opened with a quick-release button.
The source who worked on the stone and marble in the 1990s could not recall where the hidden staircase led.
